name: East Asian Music
description: Covers the different forms of music with origins in Japan, Korea, China, Taiwan, and Vietnam.

children.name: Ainu Music
children.description: Music of the Ainu people from Hokkaid≈ç, the Kuril Islands, and part of Sakhalin.

children.name: Chinese Music
children.description: Music of the Chinese people, which is primarily derived from the culture of the Han Chinese.

children.name: East Asian Classical Music
children.description: Covers all the forms of pan-East Asian Classical Music sharing origins in Chinese Classical Music.

children.name: East Asian Folk Music
children.description: All the forms of Traditional Folk Music from East Asia, including Japanese Folk Music, Chinese Folk Music, and Korean Folk Music.

children.name: Japanese Music
children.description: Japanese meta-genre covers all forms of music, traditional or contemporary, rooted in Japanese Folk Music.

children.name: Ryukyuan Music
children.description: Music of the Ryukyuan people of the Ryukyu Islands in the southwest of Japan.
